– DOWN: (3,7) is free but wouldn’t immediately put us in position to grab an apple.
– LEFT: (2,8) is where our body is, so that would mean running into ourselves.
– RIGHT: (4,8) is free, and moving there sets us up nicely to later go DOWN to (4,7) where an apple awaits.

Thus, moving RIGHT is safe and supports our strategy of collecting apples promptly for more points.

1.rationale:
Our current board shows our snake’s head at (3,7) with body segments at (4,7) and (4,8). The apples are located at (3,2), (9,9), (1,1), (0,7), and (7,2). Calculating the Manhattan distances from our head (3,7):

• To (3,2): |3–3| + |7–2| = 0 + 5 = 5  
• To (9,9): |9–3| + |9–7| = 6 + 2 = 8  
• To (1,1): |1–3| + |1–7| = 2 + 6 = 8  
• To (0,7): |0–3| + |7–7| = 3 + 0 = 3  
• To (7,2): |7–3| + |2–7| = 4 + 5 = 9

The apple at (0,7) is closest with a distance of 3.  
From our head at (3,7), our adjacent cells are:  
– UP (3,8): Open, but increases the distance (distance becomes 4).  
– DOWN (3,6): Also open, but the distance becomes |3–0|+|6–7| = 3+1 = 4.  
– LEFT (2,7): Open and yields a Manhattan distance of |2–0|+|7–7| = 2+0 = 2.  
– RIGHT (4,7): Occupied by our own body segment.

Moving LEFT is both safe and moves us closest to our target apple.

Next move: LEFT

• (9,9)

– To (1,1): |1–2| + |1–7| = 1 + 6 = 7  
– To (0,7): |0–2| + |7–7| = 2 + 0 = 2  
– To (7,2): |7–2| + |2–7| = 5 + 5 = 10

Clearly, moving LEFT to (1,7) is safe and achieves the goal of getting closer to the apple.

Strategy note for subsequent turns:
• After moving LEFT, we'll aim to continue toward (0,7) while keeping an eye on our own body and enemy snakes.
• If needed, we can adjust our path in case an enemy unexpectedly blocks us or if a more advantageous apple appears.
